required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Study of Two Different Schedules (Weekly and Tri-weekly) of Combination of Gemcitabine and Two Taxanes in MBC
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase III Trial of Gemcitabine and Docetaxel Versus Gemcitabine and Paclitaxel in Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer: A Comparison of Different Schedules

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-center, randomized Phase III study. 4 arms. 360 Patient to enroll. Purpose is evaluate time to progression disease (PD).

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Progressive Disease (TTPD) by Treatment Schedule
primary_outcome.description: TTPD is defined as the time from the day of treatment to first observation of documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever comes first. TTPD was censored at the time of last follow-up for patients who were still alive without progression. Tumor response was assessed in cancer patients by using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Progressive Disease is a ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Progressive Disease (TTPD) by Treatment Drug
primary_outcome.description: TTPD is defined as the time from the day of treatment to first observation of documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever comes first. TTPD was censored at the time of last follow-up for patients who were still alive without progression. Tumor response was assessed in cancer patients by using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Progressive Disease is a ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.description: OS is the duration from enrollment to time of death as a result of any cause. For participants who are alive, OS is censored at the last contact (date of the last follow-up visit).
OS is the duration from enrollment to time of death as a result of any cause. For participants who are alive, OS is censored at the last contact (date of the last follow-up visit).

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) by Treatment Schedule
secondary_outcome.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. Not Available=participants assessed whose data were not available. Not Assessed=participants who did not participate in assessments. The ORR=sum of complete and partial tumor responses observed, divided by the total number of evaluable participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate(ORR) by Treatment Drug
secondary_outcome.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. Not Available=participants assessed whose data were not available. Not Assessed=participants who did not participate in assessments. The ORR=sum of complete and partial tumor responses observed, divided by the total number of evaluable participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious and Nonserious Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Summary tables of serious adverse events (SAEs) and all other nonserious AEs are located in the Reported Adverse Event Module.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) Using the Rotterdam Symptom Scale Checklist (RSSC) at Beginning of 3-Week or 4-Week Cycle
secondary_outcome.description: RSSC is a valid and reliable measure of psychological and physical distress of cancer patients. Overall QOL is assessed on a 7-point scale (1=Excellent to 7=Extremely Poor). Categories include Excellent, Good, Moderately Good, Neither Good nor Bad, Rather Poor, Poor, and Extremely Poor. Number of responses to the overall QOL by treatment arm are provided. Arms A (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly) and B (Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly) were assessed every 3 weeks. Arms C (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly) and D (Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly) were assessed every 4 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) Using the Rotterdam Symptom Scale Checklist (RSSC) at 30-Day Post-therapy Visit
secondary_outcome.description: RSSC is a valid and reliable measure of psychological and physical distress of cancer patients. Overall QOL is assessed on a 7-point scale (1=Excellent to 7=Extremely Poor). Categories include Excellent, Good, Moderately Good, Neither Good nor Bad, Rather Poor, Poor, and Extremely Poor. Number of responses to the overall QOL (using the 7-point scale) by treatment arm are provided.

intervention.description: Arm A: 1000 mg/m², 30 minute (min) intravenous (IV) infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for complete responders (CRs=disappearance of all target lesions) or partial responders (PRs≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions); 6 cycles for stable disease (SD=small changes that do not meet the above criteria); or until progressive disease (PD≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions). Arm B: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm C: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

Arm A: 75 milligram per square meter (mg/m²), 60 min IV infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm C: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

Arm B: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours, followed by Gemcitabine, on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic diagnosis of metastatic breast cancer (MBC).
- Prior neoadjuvant or adjuvant taxanes regimen is allowed if ≥12 months since completion of the regimen.
- Relapsing after receiving one adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy containing an anthracycline if not clinically contraindicated.
- Patients with measurable disease.
- Previous hormonal therapy for adjuvant setting or metastatic disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous chemotherapy for MBC
- Previous chemotherapy with gemcitabine in any setting of disease
- Patient candidable to treatment with trastuzumab.

group.title: Arm A: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 75 milligram per square meter (mg/m²), 60 minute (min) intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for complete responders (CRs=disappearance of all target lesions) or partial responders (PRs≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions); 6 cycles for stable disease (SD=small changes that do not meet the above criteria); or until progressive disease (PD≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions). Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm B: Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm C: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 minutes prior Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm D: Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly)
group.description: Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm A: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 75 milligram per square meter (mg/m²), 60 minute (min) intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for complete responders (CRs=disappearance of all target lesions) or partial responders (PRs≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions); 6 cycles for stable disease (SD=small changes that do not meet the above criteria); or until progressive disease (PD≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions). Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm B: Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm C: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 minutes prior Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm D: Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly)
group.description: Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Menopausal Status
measure.description: Menopausal status is defined as the number of participants with premenopausal or postmenopausal status.

measure.title: Previous Hormonal Therapy
measure.description: Previous hormonal therapy status is defined as the number of participants who had previously received hormonal therapy.

measure.title: Presence or Absence of Visceral Metastases
measure.description: Visceral metastases are defined as any metastases to the major organs excluding bone, skin, soft tissue, and lymph nodes.

measure.title: Number of Participants with Previous Adjuvant/Neoadjuvant Taxane Therapy
measure.description: This baseline measure presents the number of participants who had previously received adjuvant/neoadjuvant taxane therapy.

measure.title: Quality of Life (QOL) using the Rotterdam Symptom Scale Checklist (RSSC)
measure.description: The RSSC is a valid and reliable instrument use to measure psychological and physical distress of cancer patients. The overall QOL of patients are assessed and categorized as: Excellent, Good, Moderately Good, Neither Good nor Bad, Rather Poor, Poor, and Extremely Poor.

outcome.title: Time to Progressive Disease (TTPD) by Treatment Schedule
outcome.description: TTPD is defined as the time from the day of treatment to first observation of documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever comes first. TTPD was censored at the time of last follow-up for patients who were still alive without progression. Tumor response was assessed in cancer patients by using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Progressive Disease is a ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population is defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on treatment schedule (Weekly vs 3 Weekly) were combined for this population. A total of 33 participants were censored with 16 (13.68%)in the Weekly arm and 17 (13.71%) participants in the 3 Weekly arm.

group.title: Treatment Schedule (Weekly)
group.description: Arm C, Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly): Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 minutes prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D, Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly): Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Treatment Schedule (3 Weekly)
group.description: Arm A, Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (3 Weekly): Docetaxel: 75 mg/m², 60 min IV infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm B, Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (3 Weekly): Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

measure.title: Time to Progressive Disease (TTPD) by Treatment Schedule
measure.description: TTPD is defined as the time from the day of treatment to first observation of documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever comes first. TTPD was censored at the time of last follow-up for patients who were still alive without progression. Tumor response was assessed in cancer patients by using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Progressive Disease is a ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
measure.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population is defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on treatment schedule (Weekly vs 3 Weekly) were combined for this population. A total of 33 participants were censored with 16 (13.68%)in the Weekly arm and 17 (13.71%) participants in the 3 Weekly arm.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) by Treatment Schedule
outcome.description: OS is the duration from enrollment to time of death as a result of any cause. For participants who are alive, OS is censored at the last contact (date of the last follow-up visit).
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on treatment schedule (Weekly vs 3 Weekly) were combined for this population. A total of 109 (45.2%) participants were censored with 53 (45.3%) in the Weekly arm and 56 (45.2%) participants in the 3 Weekly arm.

group.title: Treatment Schedule (Weekly)
group.description: Arm C, Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly): Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 minutes prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D, Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly): Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Treatment Schedule (3 Weekly)
group.description: Arm A, Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (3 Weekly): Docetaxel: 75 mg/m², 60 min IV infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm B, Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (3 Weekly): Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS) by Treatment Schedule
measure.description: OS is the duration from enrollment to time of death as a result of any cause. For participants who are alive, OS is censored at the last contact (date of the last follow-up visit).
measure.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on treatment schedule (Weekly vs 3 Weekly) were combined for this population. A total of 109 (45.2%) participants were censored with 53 (45.3%) in the Weekly arm and 56 (45.2%) participants in the 3 Weekly arm.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) by Treatment Drug
outcome.description: OS is the duration from enrollment to time of death as a result of any cause. For participants who are alive, OS is censored at the last contact (date of the last follow-up visit).
outcome.population: ITT population defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on Treatment Drug (Docetaxel+Gemcitabine vs Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine) were combined for this population. A total of 109 participants were censored with 55 (46.61%) in the Docetaxel+Gemcitabine arm and 54 (43.90%) in the Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine arm.

group.title: Treatment Drug (Docetaxel)
group.description: Arm A, Docetaxel: 75 mg/m², 60 min IV infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m² 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm C, Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15, repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Treatment Drug (Paclitaxel)
group.description: Arm B, Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by followed by Gemcitabine on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D, Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15 followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until disease progression.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS) by Treatment Drug
measure.description: OS is the duration from enrollment to time of death as a result of any cause. For participants who are alive, OS is censored at the last contact (date of the last follow-up visit).
measure.population: ITT population defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on Treatment Drug (Docetaxel+Gemcitabine vs Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine) were combined for this population. A total of 109 participants were censored with 55 (46.61%) in the Docetaxel+Gemcitabine arm and 54 (43.90%) in the Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine arm.

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) by Treatment Schedule
outcome.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. Not Available=participants assessed whose data were not available. Not Assessed=participants who did not participate in assessments. The ORR=sum of complete and partial tumor responses observed, divided by the total number of evaluable participants.
outcome.population: All randomized patients treated with at least 1 dose of Docetaxel, Paclitaxel or Gemcitabine. Treatment arms based on treatment schedule (Weekly vs 3 Weekly) were combined for this population.

group.title: Treatment Schedule (Weekly)
group.description: Arm C, Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly): Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 minutes prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D, Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly): Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Treatment Schedule (3 Weekly)
group.description: Arm A, Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (3 Weekly): Docetaxel: 75 mg/m², 60 min IV infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm B, Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (3 Weekly): Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

measure.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) by Treatment Schedule
measure.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. Not Available=participants assessed whose data were not available. Not Assessed=participants who did not participate in assessments. The ORR=sum of complete and partial tumor responses observed, divided by the total number of evaluable participants.
measure.population: All randomized patients treated with at least 1 dose of Docetaxel, Paclitaxel or Gemcitabine. Treatment arms based on treatment schedule (Weekly vs 3 Weekly) were combined for this population.

outcome.title: Time to Progressive Disease (TTPD) by Treatment Drug
outcome.description: TTPD is defined as the time from the day of treatment to first observation of documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever comes first. TTPD was censored at the time of last follow-up for patients who were still alive without progression. Tumor response was assessed in cancer patients by using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Progressive Disease is a ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
outcome.population: ITT population defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on Treatment Drug (Docetaxel+Gemcitabine vs Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine) were combined for this population. A total of 33 (13.7%) participants were censored with 17 (13.68%) in the Docetaxel+Gemcitabine arm and 18 (13.71%) in the Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine arm.

group.title: Treatment Drug (Docetaxel)
group.description: Arm A, Docetaxel: 75 mg/m², 60 min IV infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m² 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm C, Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15, repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Treatment Drug (Paclitaxel)
group.description: Arm B, Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by followed by Gemcitabine on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Arm D, Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15 followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until disease progression.

measure.title: Time to Progressive Disease (TTPD) by Treatment Drug
measure.description: TTPD is defined as the time from the day of treatment to first observation of documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever comes first. TTPD was censored at the time of last follow-up for patients who were still alive without progression. Tumor response was assessed in cancer patients by using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Progressive Disease is a ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
measure.population: ITT population defined as the population of all randomized participants. Treatment arms based on Treatment Drug (Docetaxel+Gemcitabine vs Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine) were combined for this population. A total of 33 (13.7%) participants were censored with 17 (13.68%) in the Docetaxel+Gemcitabine arm and 18 (13.71%) in the Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine arm.

Not Available=participants assessed whose data were not available. Not Assessed=participants who did not participate in assessments. The ORR=sum of complete and partial tumor responses observed, divided by the total number of evaluable participants.

group.title: Treatment Drug (Paclitaxel)
group.description: Arm B, Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by followed by Gemcitabine on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. measure.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. Not Available=participants assessed whose data were not available. Not Assessed=participants who did not participate in assessments. The ORR=sum of complete and partial tumor responses observed, divided by the total number of evaluable participants.
measure.population: All randomized participants treated with at least 1 dose of Docetaxel, Paclitaxel or Gemcitabine. Treatment arms based on Treatment Drug (Docetaxel+Gemcitabine vs Paclitaxel+Gemcitabine) were combined for this population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious and Nonserious Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Summary tables of serious adverse events (SAEs) and all other nonserious AEs are located in the Reported Adverse Event Module.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population defined as the population of all randomized participants.

group.title: Arm A: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 75 milligram per square millimeter (mg/m²), 60 minute (min) intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for complete responders (CRs=disappearance of all target lesions) or partial responders (PRs=≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions); 6 cycles for stable disease (SD=small changes that do not meet the above criteria); or until progressive disease (PD≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions). Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm B: Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm C: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 30 mg/m², 30-60 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 to be given 30 minutes prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.description: Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 800 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 repeated every 28 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Serious and Nonserious Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Summary tables of serious adverse events (SAEs) and all other nonserious AEs are located in the Reported Adverse Event Module.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population defined as the population of all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Quality of Life (QOL) Using the Rotterdam Symptom Scale Checklist (RSSC) at Beginning of 3-Week or 4-Week Cycle
outcome.description: RSSC is a valid and reliable measure of psychological and physical distress of cancer patients. Overall QOL is assessed on a 7-point scale (1=Excellent to 7=Extremely Poor). Categories include Excellent, Good, Moderately Good, Neither Good nor Bad, Rather Poor, Poor, and Extremely Poor. Number of responses to the overall QOL by treatment arm are provided. Arms A (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly) and B (Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly) were assessed every 3 weeks. Arms C (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly) and D (Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly) were assessed every 4 weeks.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population defined as all randomized participants.

group.title: Arm A: Docetaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Docetaxel: 75 milligram per square meter (mg/m²), 60 minute (min) intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 only, to be given 30 min prior to Gemcitabine, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for complete responders (CRs=disappearance of all target lesions) or partial responders (PRs≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions); 6 cycles for stable disease (SD=small changes that do not meet the above criteria); or until progressive disease (PD≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions). Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.title: Arm B: Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine (Tri-weekly)
group.description: Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 3 hours followed by Gemcitabine on Day 1, repeated every 21 days (tri-weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m², 30 min IV infusion on Days 1 and 8, repeated every 21 days for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD.

group.description: Paclitaxel: 80 mg/m², IV infusion over approximately 1 hour, Days 1, 8, and 15, followed by Gemcitabine, repeated every 28 days (weekly) for 10 cycles for CRs or PRs; 6 cycles for SD; or until PD. measure.description: RSSC is a valid and reliable measure of psychological and physical distress of cancer patients. Overall QOL is assessed on a 7-point scale (1=Excellent to 7=Extremely Poor). Categories include Excellent, Good, Moderately Good, Neither Good nor Bad, Rather Poor, Poor, and Extremely Poor. Number of responses to the overall QOL by treatment arm are provided. measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population defined as all randomized participants.

analysis.p_value_desc: This is the p-value for Treatment Schedule (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly + Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly) and Treatment Drug (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly + Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly).
This is the p-value for Treatment Drug (Docetaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly + Docetaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly vs Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine 3 Weekly + Paclitaxel and Gemcitabine Weekly).

outcome.title: Quality of Life (QOL) Using the Rotterdam Symptom Scale Checklist (RSSC) at 30-Day Post-therapy Visit
outcome.description: RSSC is a valid and reliable measure of psychological and physical distress of cancer patients. Overall QOL is assessed on a 7-point scale (1=Excellent to 7=Extremely Poor). Categories include Excellent, Good, Moderately Good, Neither Good nor Bad, Rather Poor, Poor, and Extremely Poor. Number of responses to the overall QOL (using the 7-point scale) by treatment arm are provided.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
